intro: Bichenia cineraria, commonly known as the ash-colored bichenia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and lance-shaped leaves with a grayish-green hue. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing a unique, delicate appearance. Bichenia cineraria is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
